intro: Hieracium suchonense, commonly known as the Suchon hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its yellow-orange flowers bloom in the summer, and it produces numerous small, oval-shaped seeds. Hieracium suchonense is often found in open habitats and can sometimes form dense colonies.
